On 01/20/2022 Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Bernice Karnsrithong arrived at the facility to conduct a required post licensing inspection. LPA Karnsrithong met with Director of Operations, Jaq Waldron who granted access to the facility and provided the tour. The facility is licensed to provide care and supervision for six (6) youths, ages 12-17 years; ambulatory only. The facility is located in a residential community. The facility provides drug and alcohol rehabilitation and mental health services for male clients only. The facility is gated and fenced in. The front entryway is being used for COVID-19 check in. There are four (4) fire extinguishers throughout the facility and a NEST Fire/Carbon Monoxide Detectors and Alarms throughout the house. During the inspection LPA Karnsrithong has observed the following: Living Room/Common Room: There are three (3) living rooms/common room located downstairs for clients to use. All three living rooms have couches, a table and a rug. This area is used for group activities and therapeutic sessions. The main living room is attached to the kitchen and has a desk, a television, and a book shelf with books and games for clients to use. Outdoor Area: The entire outside area is fenced in. Water and electric shut off valves are located in the front of the house. The gas shut off utility valve is located next to the gate up front. The front lawn has grass and trees. There is a outdoor patio seating with a tree and a swing located in the front yard. The backyard is fenced in and gated. It has a barn with three (3) goats, one (1) sheep and three (3) horses. There is also a chicken coop and a closed in nursery garden in the backyard. There are two (2) outside sheds to be utilized as storage next to the barn. The backyard has a basketball court, tennis court, batting cages and a skate park. The backyard has a covered deck seating that has a propane grill that is secured and safe. (Page 1 of 3)

Kitchen/Dining Room Area: The kitchen and dining room area is observed to be clean and well-maintained. A chef was observed preparing meals for the clients in the main kitchen. Menus are posted in the kitchen. LPA observed ample perishable food items in the refrigerator and the pantry is fully stocked with non-perishable food items. There is stove, refrigerator, microwaves, toaster, air fryer, and blender in the kitchen. There is a trash can with a tight fit lid in the kitchen area. There is also a working sink in the main kitchen. Pots, pans, utensils, dishes, and cups are stored in the kitchen. There is a separate kitchen area being used to prepare Kosher meals. It has its own portable stove, microwave, pots, pans, utensils, dishes, and cups. This kitchen has its own sink as well. There is also a nook bar that can be used for dining in the kosher kitchen. The dining room has a long table with ample seating for clients and staff. Office Room: There are three (3) office rooms located downstairs. One office room is being used by administrative staff and is located at the back of the house. It has wall shelf units, an office desk, and chairs. Another office room is being used for therapeutic services. It has couches, coffee table, an office desk, chairs, and a computer. This room has two doors connecting it to the other hallway next to the client downstairs bathroom. One of the doorknobs in this office room is loosed. Another office room is in front of the therapy room. It has a sink, an office desk, chairs, printer, and laptop. It has cabinets that stores medication, hygiene supplies, first aid kit, and medical supplies. It also has a refrigerator that is being used for storing medications if needed. Nursing staff also maintain and monitor the medications, health supplies, and first aid kit. All the children prescribed medications are locked in the staff office and children files are store in a KIPU software system. Staff also uses the cabinets in this room as storage for their personal items. There is a coffee maker inside this office for staff to used. All office rooms are kept locked when not in used. Garages: The attached garage is used as storage for food items and supplies and is kept locked at all times. It has a refrigerators, freezer and a pantry shelf. The laundry room is also located in this garage. There is a detached garage in the facility that is currently being used as an education and art therapy room. There are six (6) computers, tables and chairs for clients to use. There is a driveway outside the detached garage where the facility vehicle is parked at. The facility vehicle is in good working condition. (Page 2 of 3)

Bedrooms: There are four (4) bedrooms all located upstairs. One (1) bedroom is currently being used as a quarantine room for COVID and a therapy room if needed. This room has a daybed. All rooms are equipped with full sized beds, adequate closet, and drawer space and adequate lighting. Each room has a patio balcony that has double wooden doors and double screen doors. There is a master bedroom that has a couch and a full-sized bed. The master bedroom has its own bathroom with a toilet, shower, and a tub. The clients are not using the tub and inaccessible. There is walk-in closet that is kept locked in the master bedroom that will be used for storage. There are cabinets located next to the bedrooms being used for storing linens and client’s contraband items that is kept locked at all times. Each bedroom has its own facility sketch plan, client schedule, and emergency disaster plan. One bedroom has a broken and ripped screen. A door chime will be installed for patio balcony access. Bathrooms: There are four (4) bathrooms in the facility. Two (2) bathrooms are located downstairs. One is being used by staff only and is kept locked. The staff bathroom has a working toilet and sink. Another bathroom next to the therapy room is used by clients. It has a toilet, sink, and a shower. The shower is not being used. Upstairs there are two (2) bathrooms being used by clients. Both client bathrooms have a shower, double sinks, and a toilet. The faucet in the main client bathroom is loosed and not securely attached. Laundry room: The laundry room is inside of the attach garage adjacent to the kitchen. Laundry supplies are kept in the laundry room. Clients may use the washer and dryer under staff supervision. There are deficiencies cited at this time based on the following regulations: Title 22 Division 6 Section 80088(e)(3): All toilets, hand washing and bathing facilities shall be maintained in safe and sanitary operating condition. Additional equipment, aids, and/or conveniences shall be provided in facilities accommodating physically handicapped clients who need such items. Title 22 Division 6 Section 80087(a): The facility shall be clean, safe, sanitary and in good repair at all times for the safety and well-being of clients, employees and visitors. Title 22 Division 6 Section 80088(b): All window screens shall be in good repair and be free of insects, dirt and other debris. Plan of correction was discussed with licensee. Exit interview was conducted and a copy of this report will be provided to the facility via email. (Page 3 of 3)

narrative: On 02/04/2022 at 10am, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) arrived at the facility for the purpose of conducting a Plan of Correction (POC) visit. LPA Karnsrithong met with Facility Manager, Zachary Hale who granted access and tour of the facility. The current census of the facility is four (4). During the visit there were four (4) staff on site. Currently there are two (2) positive cases of COVID-19 during the visit. The clients tested positive on 02/01/2022 and are currently being quarantined. During the visit, LPA Karnsrithong observed that the facility is observing COVID-19 protocols by taking temperatures of all guests and staff coming in to the facility. All staff and clients are wearing surgical masks. There is a COVID-19 sign in at the doorway. LPA Karnsrithong had observed that the bedroom #3 window screened is in good repair. The faucet in the client bathroom upstairs is also in good repair and securely bolted in to the sink. The door knob in the Office/Therapy Room is securely attached and in good repair. The facility has met the requirements for the Plan of Corrections. No deficiencies were cited at this time. Exit interview was conducted with Facility Manager and a copy of this report will be provided to the facility.

investigation_findings: 13On 08/25/2022 at 12pm, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Bernice Karnsrithong arrived at the facility for the purpose of delivering findings for the above complaint investigation. Health and safety risk assessment was conducted upon arriving at the facility. LPA Karnsrithong met with Brenda Reyes, Facility Manager who granted access to the facility. During the investigation of the allegations, Staff inappropriately searched a minor while in care and Staff did not prevent a minor from wandering while in care; LPA Karnsrithong conducted confidential interviews and reviewed documentary evidences. There was no sufficient evidence that supports that staff inappropriately searched a minor and staff did not prevent a minor from wandering while in care. Admission Policies on Reasonable Search was provided to clients before enrollment to the facility. Statements were consistent that AWOL/Runaway communication system and policies were implemented when client goes on runaway. There was no corroborating witness. LPA determines that the allegations are unsubstantiated at this time meaning, although the allegations may have happened or is valid, there is not a preponderance of the evidence to prove that a violation occurred. Exit interview was conducted with Facility Manager and a copy of this report will be provided.

13On 08/25/2022 at 12pm, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Bernice Karnsrithong arrived at the facility for the purpose of delivering findings for the above complaint investigation. Health and safety risk assessment was conducted upon arriving at the facility. LPA Karnsrithong met with Brenda Reyes, Facility Manager who granted access to the facility. During the investigation of the allegation, Minor was not allowed to receive phone calls; LPA Karnsrithong conducted confidential interviews, conducted on-site inspections, and reviewed documentary evidences. Statements from confidential interviews were consistent that clients are not permitted to receive or make phone calls within the first seven days of admission to the facility. Facility has been cited for California Code of Regulations, Title 22 Division Six, Chapter 5 Article 06. Continuing Requirements 84072 Personal Rights: (8) To make and receive confidential telephone calls, unless prohibited by court order. Plan of correction, appeals and exit interview was conducted with Brenda Reyes, Facility Manager

narrative:
On November 3, 2022 at 9:45 AM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Charmetha White arrived at Ascend Healthcare 4, for the purpose of conducting an Annual/Required inspection. LPA met with Brenda Reyes, Facility Manager and was granted access into the facility. The facility was toured at 10:10 AM both inside and out. The facility is a private pay therapeutic treatment program licensed to provide care and supervision services for six (6) children, ages 12-17 years old, ambulatory only. The census at the time of the inspection was six (6). The facility is a one story, 4-bedroom, 4-bathroom house which includes multiple Living rooms, Dining room, Kitchen, Laundry area, Medical office, Therapist offices, Administrator office, Equine Therapy farm, Outdoor space, and Garages. The facility is set up as follows: Living rooms: there are a total of 3 (three) living rooms located on the first floor of the home. One living room is located off the kitchen and is furnished with a couch, bookshelf, a mounted television, and contains books and games for the clients. The second living room is located next to the medical office and is furnished with multiple chairs and is used as a group room. The third living room is located near the entrance of the home, it was observed be used as the music room, and it is equipped with ample seating, drums, guitars, and a piano. Dining room: is furnished with a wooden table and eight (8) chairs. Kitchen: is equipped with a 5-burner gas operated stove with a flat top grill, a microwave, refrigerator/freezer, a dishwasher, and a trash compactor. LPA observed the home to have more than a one-week supply of nonperishable foods and 2-day supply of perishable foods. LPA observed menus posted and a food pantry located next to the kitchen. Additionally, there is a separate kitchen area used to prepare Kosher meals, which contains a sink, portable stove, microwave, and separate pots, pans, utensils, dishes, and cups. Laundry area: is adjacent to the kitchen, located inside of the attached garage. The room is equipped with one (1) washer and one (1) dryer. Laundry detergent is distributed to children as needed. Report continued on LIC 808C.

Medical office: is next to the group room. The office is equipped with a computer, chair, desk, and a printer. LPA observed the room to have locked cabinets used to store medications, medical supplies, disinfectants, and cleaning supplies. Additionally, the office contains a small refrigerator for medications that require refrigeration and 2 first aid kits. The office is locked and made inaccessible to clients in care. Therapist offices: there are two (2) rooms being used for therapeutic services. The rooms are furnished with a desk, chair, a computer, and a sofa. Administrator office: is located next to the music room and is equipped with a desk, multiple bookshelves, a chair, and contains a closet observed to store extra clothing items. Equine Therapy Farm: has a barn with three (3) goats, one (1) sheep and three (3) horses; and a chicken coop. Outdoor space: The front yard is covered with grass, there is patio seating, and a tree with a swing. The backyard is fenced in and contains equine therapy farm; a closed in nursery garden; two (2) outside sheds which LPA observed to be used as therapy rooms; a basketball court, tennis court, batting cages and a skate park. Additionally, there is covered deck seating and a secured propane grill. Garages: one detached garage observed to be used as a classroom; the room had multiple computers, a table, chairs, and three (3) locked cabinets observed to be used for extra school/classroom supplies. The second garage is attached to the home and was observed to have the laundry area, and an extra refrigerator used by staff, a staff restroom, storage shelves, and two separate therapy offices equipped with desk, chairs, and a sofa. Bedroom #1: is currently being used as a therapy room. Bedroom #2: has two (2) full sized beds, adequate closet, and drawer space and adequate lighting. Bedroom #3: has two (2) full sized beds, adequate closet, and drawer space and adequate lighting. Bedroom #4: is the master bedroom and has two (2) full sized beds, adequate closet, drawer space, adequate lighting, a couch, a non-working fireplace, an attached bathroom, and a walk-in closet that is kept locked at all time. LPA observed the closet to be used for storing linens and client’s contraband. Each bedroom has a patio balcony that has double wooden doors and double screen doors. Bathrooms: All bathrooms were checked and found to be in good repair and working order. The hot water temperature was tested and found to be between 105-120 degrees (F). The carbon monoxide and smoke detectors were tested and found to be in working order. First Aid Kit was checked and found to be complete. The facility has 4 regulation fire extinguishers. The facility has a working telephone readily accessible. Report continued on LIC 809C

Overall LPA observed the facility to be clean, safe, sanitary and in good repair. The front yard and outdoor space were clean and free of debris. Passageways, stairways, inclines, ramps and open porches were unobstructed. There are no firearms or dangerous weapons in the facility. Temperatures in client rooms and common areas were found to be between 68 - 85 degrees (F). Disinfectants/cleaning solutions and poisons are stored and inaccessible to clients. The facility operates within license conditions and limitations including capacity limitations. LPA discussed and advised the Licensee to ensure the following: Children are supported and encouraged to participate in extracurricular activities. Children are allowed and encouraged to contact the licensing agency or the Foster Care Ombudsperson, in confidence, without threats or punishment for making complaints. Children are accorded dignity in personal relationships with others in the home. LPA reiterated the importance of submitting Special Incident Reports and reporting all changes within the facility to Community Care Licensing and any other appropriate agency. All posting requirements for Group Home Licensure and Emergency Plan were met. LPA observed a camera in the living room, dining room, hallways, and outside perimeter. There is no camera waiver on file and facility has not been granted the use of cameras. Facility Manager ensured LPA cameras are not activated. Facility Manager provided LPA with a copy of the Personnel Report (LIC 500). LPA will return at a later time to review client and staff records. There are no deficiencies observed or cited at this during this inspection. An exit interview was conducted with the Facility Manager, and a copy of this report was left at the facility.

narrative: On May 2, 2024, at 9:50 AM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) C. White made an unannounced visit to Ascend Healthcare 4, for the purpose of conducting a Case Management Inspection. LPA met with the Director of Operations, Jaqueline Marshall Waldron and was granted access to the facility. During this visit, LPA conducted confidential interviews, and reviewed records. LPA requested copies of the following documents: LIC 500, Client Roster, and Client Intake paperwork, medical documentation. Based on interviews and information gathered, this case management needs further investigation. Exit interview was conducted, and a copy of this report was left with the Director of Operations.

investigation_findings: 13On 02/26/2025 at 11:50 AM, LPA Jarmin arrived at Ascend Healthcare 4 to deliver findings on the allegation. LPA met with the Clinical Director and Facility Manager and explained that the investigation concluded on 02/03/2025. During the investigation, LPAs conducted confidential interviews, a health and safety assessment, and reviewed relevant documents. Findings revealed insufficient evidence to substantiate that a staff member engaged in inappropriate contact with a former youth in care. Interviews and records confirmed that the licensee took immediate action when made aware of the issue. The staff member, reassigned pending investigation, voluntarily left before the process was completed and was terminated. The facility followed policies and procedures, including staff training on client interactions and complaints. The allegation is unsubstantiated, meaning there was not enough evidence to support or disprove it. An exit interview was conducted, and a copy of the report will be provided. Amended from 02/26/2025 Findings.

narrative:
On 10/20/2022 10:30am Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Rosslyn Gray made an unannounced to ASCEND HEALTHCARE 5 for the purpose to conduct the Prelicensing Inspection. LPA met with the Program Administrator, who granted access into the home, and who provided a tour of the entire physical plant inside and out. The facility is licensed to care for up to six (6) Male and Female children, ages 12-17 years, Ambulatory only. The facility acquired Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities Joint Commission valid through 03/20/2024. Staff confirmed that there are no firearms or dangerous weapons in the facility. Group Home Overview: This is a (1) story Group Home facility. There is two (2) car garage that has been converted to a supply storage room. There are total of four (4) operable fireplaces throughout the facility. All are were observed to be secure screens. The Location of the fireplaces are in the medical room, bedroom #1, living room and the group room. There are currently no children in placement. BEDROOMS: All three (3) bedrooms are equipped with comfortable beds, mattresses, linen, blankets and pillows. There are chimes on the exit doors.The Administrator provided a notice of door chimes that are installed in each room.The alarms active to alert when doors open. Bedroom #1 Currently unoccupied, equipped with a King-size and Queen size bed adequate drawer space (built in shelves and pull-out drawers, and a walk-in bathroom (toiled bidet, large walk-in shower, two (2) sinks and ample storage space. Bedroom #2: Currently unoccupied equipped with a two (2) twin sized beds adequate drawer space (built in shelves) and three (3) open door closets. Bedroom#3 Currently unoccupied, equipped with two (2) Full size bed and adequate drawer space (built in shelves).

BATHROOMS: All were inspected and found to be clean. LPA test the water temperature, bathroom sinks and ensured that all toilets flushed and bathroom #1 has a Bidet. The water temperature measured within safe temperatures, at not less than 105 and did not exceed 120 degrees Fahrenheit. Bathroom #1 is located inside #1 and #2 is located to the left of the hallway near bedroom #2 and #3. Living Room: is equipped with 2 sectional sofas, three (3) coffee tables, a television and a securely covered fireplace. Dining Room: equipped with a large table with six (6) chairs and ample lighting. Kitchen: LPA observed the monthly/weekly menu posted on the wall. The kitchen. equipped with a double door refrigerator with a bottom freezer, an island stove with two(2)ovens, a six (6) functional gas burners. There is plenty of cabinet space, a locked box for knives and sharp objects. A weekly menu was observed and posted in the kitchen and food service adequate for breakfast, and snacks, lunch and dinner. Meals are prepared by a Private Chef. Laundry area is located near the dining room. The laundry detergent and other cleaning supplies are stored in a locked cabinet about the washer and dryer unit. The locked pantry is located adjacent to the washer and dryer unit. Chemicals and cleaning solutions are kept in locked cabinets located in the laundry room. The Administrator activated the Nest Carbon Monoxide combined smoke detector was observed and functional. LPA observed six (6) fully charged fire extinguishers located throughout the facility. The Clinical Building. This is a large two (2) story. The Clinical office is furnished with two (2) desk and storage closet for the therapist. The group room is equipped with a three (3) sofas, a large chair, a large storage closet a sink, a double burner, bathroom with 1 sink and disconnect steam room. The school is located on the 2nd floor currently under construction and will not be utilize until complete and inspected. The Administrator provided a site construction safety plan. LPA observe listed on the facility sketch as a classroom and cleared by the Fire Inspector on 08/31/2022. Medication Room: Adjacent to bathroom #1 is locked, entry is to the outside left side of building. This room is equipped with office furniture; two (2) desk two (2) chairs, locked med cabinets. LPA observed a large locked First Aid box mounted on the wall, equipped, complete with scissors, tweezers, thermometer, gauzes, antiseptic and 1st Aid Manual. There is also a small refrigerator for storage of client medication that requires refrigeration.

The outdoor perimeter area: The large outdoor area space free of obstructions surrounded with several historical trees. The front, and all exits were observed to be free and clear of hazards and obstruction. LPA observed all windows, screens, blinds, and drapes from the inside and outside were observed to be in good condition. There are no security bars on the windows. Sheds: There is shed for lawn care tools, there is Animal Assisting Shed for the Eco therapist. Tennis court, garden area, a three (3) stall stable that houses four (4) goats, two(2) sheep and a one (1) large pig. There is a composting bin. Pool area: The is a eight feet (8) swimming pool and a shed that has a pool pump and pool supplies that meets regulations. Located in the backyard, there is a fenced and gated pool on the premises that meets regulations. Licensee will ensure that individual supervising children in the pool area is Water Safety trained. Facility appears to be clean, safe, sanitary, and in good repair. There is Koi Pond located at the entrance of the facility inspected and with an approved net covering and a Jacuzzi located near the Clinical Building. The Administrator displayed were the gas shut-off valves are located at the end of driveway and water shut-off valve located outside back of the facility near the Medication room. All posting requirements and Emergency Plan were observed. Children will be accorded personal rights.The grievance Procedure and Personal Rights; are posted on the wall. Children are not restricted to make phones calls to family and or authorized representative. Client will be permitted to make phones calls and stored on electronic program. The Administrator will ensure to utilized the Unusual Incident Report LIC 624, and LIC 624LE to document incidents. Clients Records: Child’s Needs and Services plans will be electronically stored in the facilities online Portal with Kipuworks.com electronically stored. Staff Records are electronically stored in the ISolved system. LPA thoroughly reviewed three (3) the records of active primary staff; Program Administrator, Director of Facilities and the Facility Manager, There were no deficiencies cited at this time. LPA concluded the Pre license Inspection. An Exit interview was conducted, and a copy of this report was left at the facility with the Program Administrator

On March 23, 2023, at 9:50 AM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Charmetha White made an unannounced visit to Ascend Healthcare 5, for the purpose of conducting a Post Licensing Inspection. LPA met with Brenda Reyes, Facility Manager who granted access to the facility and together a tour of the entire interior and exterior physical plant was conducted. The facility is a private pay Group Home running a therapeutic treatment program licensed to provide care and supervision services for up to six (6) male and female children, ages 12-17 years old, ambulatory only. The facility acquired a Rehabilitation Facilities Joint Commission Accreditation which is valid through 03/20/2024. Staff confirmed there are no firearms or dangerous weapons on the premises. The census at the time of the inspection was six (6). The Group Home is set up as follows: This is a single-story, three (3) bedrooms, 2 bathrooms house which includes: Living room, Dining room, Kitchen, Laundry area, Medication room, Detached Clinical Building, Equine Therapy farm, Outdoor space, and a Detached Garage. Living Room: is equipped with 2 sectional sofas, three (3) coffee tables, a television and a securely covered fireplace. Dining Room: is equipped with a large table with six (6) chairs. Kitchen: is equipped with a double door refrigerator/freezer, six (6) burner gas operated stove (all burners were operable at the time of the inspection), two (2) ovens, a dishwasher, a trash compactor, a microwave, and a coffee machine. LPA observed the kitchen to have pots, pans, utensils, dishes, cups, plenty of cabinet space, the weekly menu was posted, and the knives and sharps were in a locked kitchen cabinet to the left of the refrigerator. There was an adequate supply of food and meals are prepared offsite by a Private Chef and brought over to the home. Laundry area is located along the hall leading to the side of the house and includes one (1) washer and one (1) dryer. Laundry detergent is kept locked in cabinets above the washer and dryer. Additionally, this area has an exit door which opens to the side of the facing the stairs of the clinical building. There is also a separate small room adjacent to the washer and dryer, which remains locked at all times. LPA observed the room to have a sink and it is used to store extra supplies, chemicals, and cleaning solutions. Report continued on LIC 809C (Page 1 of 3).

Medication Room: is located next to bathroom #1 and is only accessible through an entry at the back of the house. The room is equipped with two (2) desks, two (2) chairs, locked cabinets that store medication and medical supplies. There is a First Aid box mounted on the wall, that LPA observed to be equipped with scissors, tweezers, gauzes, and antiseptic, and a digital thermometer. The room also contains a small locked refrigerator to storage client medication that requires refrigeration. The Clinical Building. This is a two-story building located next to the house. The first floor is used as a classroom which is equipped six (6) desks, computers, chairs, a long table, cabinets observed to be used for extra school/classroom supplies, and a bathroom. The bathroom contains a sink and a toilet. There is also a separate office next to the classroom. This room is used by the therapist as a group room and contains a desk, chair, a sofa, and a closet. The second floor is equipped with a conference desk, multiple chairs, storage closets, and a small bathroom. The bathroom contains a toilet, a sink, and a door which opens to an unfinished closet. Equine Therapy Farm: has a barn with four (4) goats, two (2) sheep, two (2) horses, one (1) pig, and a chicken coop. Outdoor space: contains a Koi pond, pool/jacuzzi, and a tennis/basketball court. LPA observed the pool area to fenced and gated to meet regulations. There is also a shed in the backyard that contains the pool pump and pool supplies. The Koi Pond is located at the entrance of the house and was equipped with an approved net covering. Detached Garage: LPA observed the garage to be used for extra storage. 3 Bedrooms: Bedroom #1: is equipped with one (1) King-size bed and one (1) Queen size bed. The room has adequate drawer space, built in shelves, pull-out drawers, double patio doors leading to the side of the house, and a walk-in bathroom. The bathroom has double sinks, a section containing a toilet and a bidet, and a separate section containing a walk-in shower. LPA observed a walk-in closet located in the bathroom which remains locked at all time and it is used for storage. Bedroom #2: is equipped with two (2) Twin sized beds and has adequate drawer space, three closets, and built in shelves. Bedroom#3 is equipped with two (2) Full size beds and has adequate drawer space and built in shelves. LPA observed all three (3) bedrooms to have comfortable mattresses, linens, blankets, and pillows. Each room has door chimes installed on the exit doors tht sounds an alarm when the door opens. 2 Bathrooms: Bathroom #1: is located inside of bedroom #1. Bathroom #2: is located along the hallway catacorner to the kitchen and near bedroom #1 and #2. Report continued on LIC 809C (Page 2 of 3).

Additionally, there are two (2) other bathrooms located in the detached clinical building. All bathrooms were inspected and found to be in good repair and working order. The hot water temperature was tested and found to be between 105-120 degrees (F). The carbon monoxide and smoke detectors were tested and found to be in working order. First Aid Kit was checked and found to be complete. The facility has six (6) regulation fire extinguishers. The facility has a working telephone readily accessible. Temperatures in client rooms and common areas were found to be between 68 - 85 degrees (F). Disinfectants/cleaning solutions and poisons are stored and inaccessible to clients. LPA observed the facility to be clean, safe, sanitary and in good repair. The outdoor spaces were clean and clear of hazards. Passageways, open porches, and all exits were observed to be unobstructed. There were no security bars on the windows. Licensee ensures that individuals supervising children in the pool area is Water Safety trained. The facility operates within license conditions and limitations including capacity limitations. LPA discussed and advised the Licensee to ensure the following: Children are afforded their Personal Rights. Children are allowed and encouraged to contact the licensing agency or the Foster Care Ombudsperson, in confidence, without threats or punishment for making complaints. Children are accorded dignity in personal relationships with others in the home. All posting requirements for Group Home Licensure, including the Emergency Plan, and grievance procedure were met and posted on the wall. The LPA reiterated the importance of submitting Special Incident Reports and reporting all changes within the facility to Community Care Licensing and any other appropriate agency. Licensee will ensure to utilize the Unusual Incident Report LIC 624, and LIC 624LE to document incidents. Facility Manager provided LPA with a copy of the Personnel Report (LIC 500). LPA will return at a later time to review client and staff records. There are no deficiencies observed or cited at this during this inspection. Exit interview was conducted with the Facility Manager, and a copy of this report was left at the facility. (Page 3 of 3).

Children are allowed and encouraged to contact the licensing agency or the Foster Care Ombudsperson, in confidence, without threats or punishment for making complaints. Children are accorded dignity in personal relationships with others in the home. LPA reiterated the importance of reporting and submitting Incident Reports, Law Enforcement contact, and reporting all changes within the facility to Community Care Licensing and any other appropriate agencies. The Administrator will ensure the Unusual Incident Report LIC 624, and LIC 624LE forms are utilized to document incidents. Clients Records are electronically stored in the facilities online Portal with Kipuworks.com Staff Records are electronically stored in the ISolved system. Facility Manager provided LPA with a copy of the Personnel Report (LIC 500). LPA will return at a later date to review client and staff records. There are no deficiencies observed or cited at this during this inspection. Exit interview was conducted with the Facility Manager, and a copy of this report was left at the facility. (Page 3 of 3)

On 10/31/2023 at 9:30 AM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) C. White, made an announced visit to Ascend Healthcare 5, for the purpose of conducting a Case Management Annual Continuation Inspection. LPA met with Facility Manager, Brenda Reyes. LPA was granted access to the facility and provided the requested information. The facility keeps clients records electronically stored in an online system call KIPUERM and staff Records are electronically stored in the ISolved system. LPA reviewed the following records during the inspection: Client Records: The program currently has a total of six (6) clients. LPA reviewed all six client records and found each record to meet required regulations. Staff Records: The program currently has a total of fourteen (14) staff. LPA reviewed a total of five (5) staff records and confirmed files contained staff qualifications, current CPR/First Aid cards, health screening, and TB test results. LPA obtained the LIC 500 to verify Staff to Client ratio. LPA reviewed the Facility Profile and Personnel Report and confirmed that personnel have required criminal record clearance: DOJ, FBI and Child Abuse; which meet qualification. LPA conducted interviews with five (5) clients and a total of two (2) staff. This inspection included an overview of required Core Services and Supports and based upon inspection of facility records and interviews of staff and clients. Licensee is meeting all requirements. There were deficiencies cited per California Code of Regulations and Interim Licensing Standards. Exit interview was conducted, Appeal Rights and a copy of this report was given to the Administrator.

On November 20, 2024, at 10:40 AM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) C. made an unannounced visit to Ascend Healthcare 5, for the purpose of conducting an Annual/Required Inspection. LPA met with Brenda Reyes, Facility Manager who granted access to the facility and together a tour of the entire interior and exterior physical plant was conducted. The facility is licensed to provide care and supervision services for up to six (6) male and female children, ages 12-17 years old, ambulatory only. There a no firearms or dangerous weapons on the premises. The census at the time of the inspection was six (6). The Group Home is set up as follows: This is a single-story house that includes three (3) bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a living room, dining room, kitchen, laundry area, and a detached two (2) car garage. The home also includes a medication room, a detached clinical building, an equine therapy farm, and outdoor space. Living Room: is equipped with sofas, coffee tables, a mounted television and a covered fireplace. Dining Room: is equipped with a large table with six (6) chairs. Kitchen: is equipped with a double door refrigerator with a bottom freezer, an island stove with six (6) functional gas burners and two (2) ovens, a dishwasher, a trash compactor, a microwave, a coffee machine, an electric ice machine, pots, pans, eating utensils, dishes, and cups. LPA observed the knives and sharps locked in toolbox and kept in a locked kitchen cabinet located to the left of the refrigerator. LPA observed the food menu posted. The facility had the required 2 days of perishable/1 week of non-perishable food supply on the premises and meals are prepared offsite by a Private Chef and brought over to the home. Laundry Area: is adjacent to the kitchen and includes one (1) washer and one (1) dryer. Laundry detergent and cleaning supplies are kept locked in cabinets located this area. The laundry area has an exit door that opens to the side of the home. Additionally, the laundry area has a pantry that is kept locked at all times. LPA observed the pantry to have a sink and it is used to store additional chemicals and cleaning solutions. Detached Garage: LPA observed the garage to be used for extra storage. Report continued on LIC 809C (Page 1 of 3).

Medication Room: is only accessible through an entry at the back of the house and is kept locked when not in use. The room is equipped with a desk, chairs, a locked medication cabinet which stores medication, medical supplies, and first aid supplies. The room has a small locked refrigerator to store medication requiring refrigeration. The room has an additional mounted First Aid box complete with tweezers, scissors, gauzes, and antiseptic. Clinical Building. This is a separate two-story building adjacent to the main house. The first floor is used as a classroom that is equipped with six (6) desks, computers, and chairs. The room has a large storage closet which remains locked at all times. LPA observed the cabinet to have extra school/classroom supplies. The room contains a bathroom with a sink and a toilet. There is a separate office next to the classroom, used by the therapist as a group/therapy office. The office contains a desk, chairs, a sofa, a closet which used for storage. The second floor is equipped with a conference desk, multiple chairs, storage closets, and a small bathroom. The bathroom contains a toilet, a sink, and a door which opens to an unfinished closet. Equine Therapy Farm: has a barn, goats, sheep, horses, a pig, and a chicken coop. Outdoor space: the home has a large outdoor space that contains a Koi pond near the front entrance and is equipped with an a net covering; a pool on the side of the home which is fenced and gated to meet regulations; a jacuzzi equipped with a net covering, and a tennis/basketball court in the back of the home. Small shed: located behind the clinical building which is used to store maintenance supplies. 3 Bedrooms: Bedroom #1: is equipped with one (1) King-size bed and one (1) Queen size bed. The room has adequate drawer space, built in shelves, and pull-out drawers. The room has a walk-in bathroom. The bathroom has double sinks, a toilet and a bidet, and a separate enclosure containing a walk-in shower. There is a walk-in closet located in the bathroom that is used for storage and remains locked at all times. Bedroom #2: is equipped with two (2) Twin sized beds. The room has adequate drawer space, three closets, and built in shelves. Bedroom#3 is equipped with two (2) Full size beds. The room has adequate drawer space and built in shelves. LPA observed all three (3) bedrooms to have linens, blankets, pillows, and working lights. 2 Bathrooms: Bathroom #1: is located inside of bedroom #1. Bathroom #2: is located along the hallway near the the kitchen and bedroom #1 and #2. Report continued on LIC 809C (Page 2 of 3).

Additionally, there are two (2) other bathrooms located in the detached clinical building. All bathrooms were inspected and found to be in good repair and working order. The hot water temperature was tested and found to be between 105-120 degrees (F). The carbon monoxide and smoke detectors were tested and found to be in working order. The facility has six (6) regulation fire extinguishers. The facility has a working telephone readily accessible. Temperatures in client rooms and common areas are maintained by a central air and heating system and the home was found to be between 68 - 85 degrees (F). LPA observed the facility to be clean, safe, sanitary and in good repair. The outdoor spaces were clean and clear of hazards. Passageways, open porches, and all exits were observed to be unobstructed. There were no security bars on the windows. Licensee ensures that individuals supervising children in the pool area is Water Safety trained. The facility operates within license conditions and limitations including capacity limitations. All posting requirements for Group Home Licensure, including the Emergency Plan, Personal Rights, and Grievance Procedures were met and posted on the wall. LPA discussed the following: Children are afforded their Personal Rights. Children are allowed and encouraged to contact the licensing agency or the Foster Care Ombudsperson, in confidence, without threats or punishment for making complaints. Children are accorded dignity in personal relationships with others in the home. LPA reiterated the importance of reporting and submitting Incident Reports, Law Enforcement contact, and reporting all changes within the facility to Community Care Licensing and any other appropriate agencies. The Administrator will ensure the Unusual Incident Report LIC 624, and LIC 624LE forms are utilized to document incidents. Clients Records are electronically stored in the facilities online Portal with Kipuworks.com Staff Records are electronically stored in the ISolved system. Facility Manager provided LPA with a copy of the Personnel Report (LIC 500) and a current Client Roster (LIC 9020). LPA will return at a later date to review client and staff records. There are no deficiencies observed or cited at this during this inspection. Exit interview was conducted with the Facility Manager, and a copy of this report was left at the facility. (Page 3 of 3).

On April 9, 2024, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) C. White arrived at Ascend Healthcare #7 for the purpose of conducting a Group Home Pre-licensing inspection. LPA met with Director of Operations, Jaqueline Marshall Waldron and Administrator, Brenda Reyes who granted access to the facility and provided the tour. Ascend Healthcare #7 is a therapeutic treatment program designed to accept “Private Placement's” for a length of 45 to 90 days. The facility will be licensed to provide care and supervision for six (6) children, ages 12-17 years old; ambulatory only. Currently the census is zero (0). The facility is set up as follows: This is a single-story home. There are three (3) bedrooms, five (5) bathrooms, living room, dining room, kitchen, a group room, a classroom, medication room, a clinical room, two (2) offices, laundry room, an attached garage, and outdoor/backyard area. Living room: has a sectional sofa, operational gas burning fireplace equipped with security glass, and a door leading to the patio and backyard. Dining room: Is equipped with a wooden table with eight (8) chairs. Kitchen: Is equipped with refrigerator/freezer, a gas stove with six (6) working burners, two (2) microwaves, dishwasher, and a pantry. LPA observed a covered trash can with a mechanical foot closing device. There were ample plates, cups, and eating utensils. Sharp knives will be stored in a locked drawer in the medical room. LPA observed ample non-perishable food items and snacks in pantry. The Applicant will ensure that three (3) nutritious meals and snacks will be provided to the children in care. Group Room: One group room has a mirrored wall, eight (8) chairs, an operational gas burning fireplace equipped with security glass, and wall to floor windows looking out to the backyard. Classroom: The has six (6) desks, chairs, computers, and an operational electric fireplace equipped with security screen. The room also has an attached bathroom. Medication room: was observed to have a standing locked cabinet for use to store PRN medications and separate bins for prescribed medications for individual children; multiple locked and labeled cabinets; a complete First Aid kit; a small locked refrigerator for use to store medication. Report continued on LIC 809C. (Page 1 of 3).

The following was discussed with the facility Administrator: Children will be accorded personal rights. Children in care will be supported, encouraged to participate in extracurricular activities. Children in care will be able to contact the licensing agency. Children will be supervised & protected at all times. Children will be accorded dignity in personal relationships with others in the home. Children will not be restricted in telephone use except by court order. Applicant will ensure to have written authorization to obtain medical and dental care. Applicant will ensure to have personal rights forms in children’s files. Applicant acknowledges abuse reporting requirements. Staff working in the facility will have DOJ/FBI criminal record clearances, and Child Abuse Index Checks. Facility will operate within license conditions & limitations including capacity limit. Facility meets posting requirements. There were no deficiencies cited at this time. LPA concluded the Pre license Inspection. An Exit interview was conducted, and a copy of this report was left at the facility with the Program Administrator. (Page 3 of 3).

Clinical room: has a desk, chair, and two (2) chairs. The room has a door that opens to the backyard. Offices: are located near the classroom. Each room has two (2) chairs. Laundry room: is located near the medication room. The room is equipped with one (1) washer, one (1) dryer, and a sink. This room also has a door that opens to the garage. Attached Garage: is used to store disinfectants and extra cleaning supplies, which will be made inaccessible to children in care. Bedrooms: There are three (3) bedrooms. Bedroom #1 is equipped with two (2) twin beds; Bedroom #2 is equipped with two (2) queen size beds; Bedroom #3 is equipped with two (2) twin beds. All rooms have adequate closet and drawer space and working lights. Bathrooms: There are five (5) bathrooms. One bathroom is located in the classroom; one bathroom is located in bedroom #3; one bathroom is located next to bedroom #2; one bathroom is located in the hallway to the left of the entrance; and one bathroom is located next to the medical room. All bathrooms have a toilet, sink, and a shower. Bathrooms were found to be clean and in working order. Outdoor Area: The entire property is fenced in. Water and electric shut off valves are located in the front of the house. The gas shut off utility valve is located next to the gate up front. The front lawn has grass and trees. The backyard has a gated pool and jacuzzi that meet regulations. There is an outside seating area that contains a gas grill, a small refrigerator, a table with eight (8) chairs, and a sofa. There is an enclosed garden, a chicken coop, a shed used to store animal food and supplies, and a large, detached garage which will be used for storage. LPA observed the home to have ten (10) regulation fire extinguishers. The smoke detectors and carbon monoxide alarm were tested and found to be operating properly. There are no security bars on the windows. There are no firearms or dangerous weapons in the home. The gas shut off valve is located in the back of the house, the water shut off valve is in the front of the home, and the electric shut off panel is located in the attached garage. Facility appears to be clean, safe, sanitary, and in good repair. Passageways and porch were clean and in good repair. The front and back yard were free of debris and hazardous material. Report continued on LIC 809C. (Page 2 of 3).

met_with: Jaqueline Marshall Waldron - Administrator, and Brenda Reyes - Facility Manager
narrative:
On April 24, 2025 at 10:30 AM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Charmetha White made an announced visit to Ascend Healthcare #8 for the purpose of completing the Group Home Pre-Licensing Inspection. LPA met with Administrator, Jaqueline Marshall Waldron, and Facility Manager, Brenda Reyes and was granted access to the facility. This facility will be licensed to provide care and supervision for six (6) children ages 12-17 years old, ambulatory only. Current census is zero (0). The facility is set up as follows: This is a two-story home located in a residential neighborhood. There are four (4) bedrooms, five and one half (5 ½) bathrooms, living room, dining room, kitchen, group room, lounge room, medication office, four (4) office rooms, classroom area, laundry area, an attached garage, and backyard area. Living room: Is equipped with a sectional sofa, two (2) chairs, a mounted TV, and an operational gas burning fireplace equipped a retractable glass security door. The room has windows, working lights and opens to the dining room. Dining room: Is equipped with a wooden table with eight (8) chairs, and a glass chandelier. The room has windows, working lights, and opens to the kitchen. Kitchen: Is equipped with a double door refrigerator/freezer, double ovens, a kitchen island with a five (5) burner gas cooktop (all operational at the time of the inspection), a microwave, dishwasher, and trash compactor. LPA observed a wooden table with two (2) benches, a covered trash can, two (2) locked pantries, plenty of cabinet space, ample plates, cups, and eating utensils. Sharp knives are stored in a locked cabinet located next to the sink and made inaccessible. A weekly menu was posted, and food will be prepared by a private chef and delivered to the home. The applicant will ensure that three (3) nutritious meals and snacks will be provided to the clients in care. Group Room: is equipped with eight (8) chairs, window, and working lights. The room has patio doors which lead to the side of the house containing the equine therapy farm. Report Continued on LIC 809C (Page 1 of 3)

Lounge Room: is equipped with a couch, two (2) chairs, a small wooden coffee table, an operational gas burning fireplace equipped with an iron screen, windows, working lights, and a patio door leading to the backyard. This room will be used for visitation. Medication Office: is located off the kitchen next to a staircase leading the second floor. The room is equipped with multiple built in locked cabinets, which store PRN medications, first aid supplies, separate bins for prescribed medications for individual clients, and a locked bock for additional sharps. The room also contains a small combination lock refrigerator to store medications, a sink, windows, working lights, and a door that leads to the backyard. 4 Offices: One office is located to the left of the lounge room and will be used for therapy. The is equipped with a desk and chair, a sofa, two (2) additional chairs, a small wooden coffee table, and a bookshelf. The room opens to the Second office which will be used for therapy. This room is equipped with a mounted TV. The Third office is attached to the group room. This office is equipped with a sofa, two (2) chairs, a desk and chair, a mounted TV, a operational gas burning fireplace equipped a retractable glass security door, windows, working lights, and built in shelves. The Forth office is located on the second floor to next to the classroom area and will be used for staff. The room is equipped a desk, chair, built in cabinet space, and contains the WiFi and cable connections. Classroom Area: This area is located on the second and is equipped with six (6) computers, six (6) wooden desk and chairs, a wooden table with five (5) chairs, a pool table, and multiple windows. There is a locked storage closet at the top of the stairs which will be used to store classroom supplies. Additionally, this closet has an unlocked crawl space door leading the homes insulation. Laundry area: is located inside the attached garage and has a washer/dryer. LPA observed locked cabinets above the appliances which contain additional disinfectants and laundry supplies. Attached Garage: This is a 3-car garage which will be used for storage. LPA observed an additional refrigerator, freezer, mattresses, and boxes in this area. Backyard area: contains a ½ court basketball area, a hooded grill, a fenced and gated pool/jacuzzi that meets regulations, a enclosed trampoline, a small garden, a wooden table with two (2) attached benches, and a working firepit. On the side of the home is small equine therapy farm that has 4 goats, chickens, and a small barn. The barn contains a chicken coop, built in storage cabinets that store animal supplies, two (2) desk, and two (2) chairs. Bedroom #1: is equipped with two (2) twin size beds, built in storage shelves with four (4) drawers, and two (2) nightstands. Bedroom #2: is equipped with two (2) full size beds, built in storage shelves with four (4) drawers. The room also has a walk-in closet that will remain locked at all times and not be used due to access to a crawl space that lead to the homes insulation. Bedroom #3: is equipped with one (1) full size bed, a dresser, and two (2) closets with built in shelves. Report Continued on LIC 809C (Page 2 of 3)

Bedroom #4: is equipped with one (1) full size bed, a dresser, and a walk-in closet that has separate locked door leading the hallway. All bedrooms were all observed to have mattresses, bed linen, blankets, pillows, windows, and working lights. Bathrooms: Three bathrooms are located on the first floor. Two bathrooms are located on the second floor. The bathrooms contain a toilet, sink, and shower. There is also a ½ bathroom located near the front entrance that contains a toilet and a sink. All bathrooms were checked and found to be in working order. The hot water was tested, and the temperature was found to be between 105 -120 (F). LPA observed the home to have eight (8) regulation fire extinguishers. The smoke detectors and carbon monoxide alarm were tested and found to be operating properly. The First Aid kit was checked and found to be complete with scissors, tweezers, thermometer, and gauzes, antiseptic and First Aid Manual Guide. Extra linens, hygiene supplies, and disinfectants were stored in locked hallway closets. There are no security bars on the bedroom windows. There are no firearms or dangerous weapons in the home.Facility appears to be clean, safe, sanitary, and in good repair. Passageways and porch were clean and in good repair. The front and back yard were free of debris and hazardous material. Applicant showed LPA were the gas shut-off valves, the electrical panel, and water shut off valves were located. The following was discussed with the facility Administrator: Children will be accorded personal rights. Children in care will be supported, encouraged to participate in extracurricular activities. Children in care will be able to contact the licensing agency. Children will be supervised & protected at all times. Children will be accorded dignity in personal relationships with others in the home. Children will not be restricted in telephone use except by court order. Applicant will provide and ensure three nutritious meals, snacks, and special diets. Applicant will ensure to have written authorization to obtain medical and dental care. Applicant will ensure to have personal rights forms in children’s files. Applicant acknowledges abuse reporting requirements. Staff working in the facility will have DOJ/FBI criminal record clearances, and Child Abuse Index Checks. Facility will operate within license conditions & limitations including capacity limit. LPA observed the vehicle to have valid car insurance through Ace Property & Casualty Insurance Company. LPA concluded the Pre license Inspection. An Exit interview was conducted, and a copy of this report was left at the facility with the Program Administrator. (Page 3 of 3)

On July 30, 2025, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) C. White arrived at Ascend Healthcare #8 for the purpose of conducting a Group Home Post Licensing Inspection. LPA met with the Facility Manager, Brenda Reyes and who granted access to the facility and provided the tour facility. Ascend Healthcare #8 is a therapeutic treatment program designated to accept “Private Placement’s”. The facility is licensed to provide care and supervision for six (6) children ages 12-17 years old, ambulatory only. Current census is five (5). The facility is set up as follows: This is a two-story home located in a residential neighborhood. There are four (4) bedrooms, five and one half (5 ½) bathrooms, living room, dining room, kitchen, group room, lounge room, medication office, four (4) office rooms, classroom area, laundry area, an attached garage, and backyard area. Living room: Is equipped with a sofa, a mounted TV, and an operational gas burning fireplace equipped a retractable glass security door. The room has windows, working lights and opens to the dining room. Dining room: Is equipped with a wooden table with eight (8) chairs. The room has windows, working lights, and opens to the kitchen. Kitchen: Is equipped with a double door refrigerator/freezer, double ovens, a kitchen island with a five (5) burner gas cooktop (all operational at the time of the inspection), a microwave, dishwasher, and a trash compactor. The room has a wooden table with two (2) benches, a covered trash can, two (2) locked pantries, and ample plates, cups, and eating utensils. Sharp knives are stored in a locked cabinet next to the sink and made inaccessible to children in care. A weekly menu was posted, and food is prepared by a private chef then delivered to the home. Licensee ensures children in care receive three (3) nutritious meals and snacks. Report continued on LIC 809C (page 1 of 4).

Group Room: is equipped with eight (8) chairs, has a window, and working lights. The room has patio doors that lead to the left side of the house. Lounge Room: is equipped with a couch, chairs, a wooden coffee table, an operational gas burning fireplace equipped with an iron screen, windows, working lights, and a patio door leading to the backyard. Medication Office: is located off the kitchen. The room is equipped with built-in locked cabinets, which store PRN medications, first aid supplies, separate bins for prescribed medications for individual clients, and a locked box for additional sharps. The room also contains a small combination lock refrigerator to store medications, a sink, windows, working lights, and a door that leads to the backyard. 4 Offices: One office located to the left of the lounge room, is used for therapy; the room is equipped with a desk and chair, a sofa, two (2) additional chairs, a wooden coffee table, and a bookshelf. The room opens to a Second office which is also used for therapy; this room is equipped with a mounted TV. The Third office is attached to the group room; this office is equipped with a sofa, two (2) chairs, a desk and chair, a mounted TV, an operational gas burning fireplace equipped a retractable glass security door, windows, working lights, and built in shelves. The Forth office, located on the second floor, is being used by staff; the room is equipped with a desk, chair, built in cabinet space, and contains the WiFi and cable connections. Classroom Area: This area is located on the second floor and is equipped with six (6) computers, six (6) wooden desks and chairs, a wooden table and chairs, and multiple windows. There is a locked storage closet at the top of the stairs which will be used to store classroom supplies. Additionally, this closet has an unlocked crawl space door leading to the homes’ insulation. Laundry area: is located inside the attached garage and has a washer/dryer. LPA observed locked cabinets above the appliances which contain additional disinfectants and laundry supplies. Attached Garage: This is a 3-car garage which will be used for storage. LPA observed an additional refrigerator, freezer, mattresses, and boxes in this area. Backyard area: contains a ½ court basketball area, a hooded grill, a fenced and gated pool/jacuzzi that meets regulations, an enclosed trampoline, a small garden, a wooden table with two (2) attached benches, and a working firepit. On the side of the home is an equine therapy farm that has 4 goats, chickens, and a small barn. The barn contains a chicken coop, built in storage cabinets that store animal supplies, two (2) desks, and two (2) chairs. Bedroom #1: is equipped with two (2) twin size beds, built in storage shelves with four (4) drawers, and two (2) nightstands. Report continued on LIC 809C (page 2 of 4)

Bedroom #2: is equipped with two (2) full size beds, built in storage shelves with four (4) drawers. The room also has a walk-in closet that will remain locked at all times and not be used due to access to a crawl space that leads to the home’s insulation. Bedroom #3: is equipped with one (1) full size bed, a dresser, and two (2) closets with built-in shelves. Bedroom #4: is equipped with one (1) full size bed, a dresser, and a walk-in closet that has separate locked door leading the hallway. All bedrooms were all observed to have mattresses, bed linen, blankets, pillows, windows, and working lights. Bathrooms: Three bathrooms are located on the first floor. Two bathrooms are located on the second floor. The bathrooms contain a toilet, sink, and shower. There is also a ½ bathroom located near the front entrance that contains a toilet and a sink. All bathrooms were checked and found to be in working order. The hot water was tested, and the temperature was found to be between 105 -120 (F). LPA observed the home to have regulation fire extinguishers. The smoke detectors and carbon monoxide alarm were tested and found to be operating properly. The First Aid kit was checked and found to be complete. Extra linens, hygiene supplies, and disinfectants were stored in locked hallway closets. There are no security bars on the bedroom windows. There are no firearms or dangerous weapons in the home. Facility appears to be clean, safe, sanitary, and in good repair. Passageways and porch were clean and in good repair. The front and back yard were free of debris and hazardous material. The following was discussed with the facility Administrator: Children will be accorded personal rights. Children in care will be supported, encouraged to participate in extracurricular activities. Children in care will be able to contact the licensing agency. Children will be supervised & protected at all times. Children will be accorded dignity in personal relationships with others in the home. Children will not be restricted in telephone use except by court order. Licensee acknowledges abuse reporting requirements. Staff working in the facility have DOJ/FBI criminal record clearances, and Child Abuse Index Checks. Facility operates within license conditions & limitations including capacity limit. Report continued on LIC 809C (page 3 of 4).

LPA reviewed the LIC Personnel Report and Guardian Roster. LPA informed, Facility Manager, Brenda Reyes that the following 10 staff members: Brenda Reyes, Kyle Difulvio, Laura Hubbard, Gabriel Andrade, Xena Blair, Larissa Perez, Erika Gomez, Kayla Holcolm, Spencer Bartlett, and Kayle Yi, who were working and present in the facility at the time of the inspection, were not associated to the facility per licensing regulations. Additionally, the facility does not have a Facility Manager for every shift and does not have a certified Administrator. LPA informed Facility Manager, Brenda Reyes, that the facility would be cited. PER California Code Regulations, TITLE 22, DIVISION 6, CHAPTERS 5, General Licensing Regulations the following deficiencies were observed and cited at the time of this inspection, 80019(e)(3) Criminal Record Clearance; 84065(d) Personnel Requirements; 84064(b) Administrator Qualifications and Duties. (See LIC 809D). LPA will return at a later date to review client files and complete Staff file review. An exit interview was conducted, and a copy of this report was emailed to the Facility Manager, Brenda Reyes. (Page 4 of 4).

On April 7, 2023 March 30, 2023, at 1:20 PM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Charmetha White made an unannounced visit to Ascend Healthcare #6 for the purpose of conducting a Case Management for Special Incident Report regarding BCIA 8572. LPA requested a copy of Client #1 (C1) intake paperwork, shift notes regarding C1, and Staff #2 employee file and training record. This incident needs further investigation. Based on information obtained during this visit, no deficiencies were cited per Title 22, Division 6, of the California Code of Regulations. Exit interview was conducted, and a copy of this report was left with the Administrator.

met_with: Administrator - Jacqueline Marshall Waldron and Facility Manager - Emely Hernandez
narrative:
On December 11, 2023, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) C. White made an announced visit to Ascend Healthcare #6 for the purpose of conducting an Annual/Required Inspection. LPA met with Facility Manager, Emely Hernandez, and Administrator Jaqueline Marshall Waldron and was granted access to the facility. This facility is licensed to provide care and supervision for six (6) female children ages 12-17 years old, ambulatory only. Current census is five (5). This three (3) bedroom, four (4) bathroom single-story home located in a residential neighborhood. The facility includes the following: living room, dining room, kitchen, group room, medication room, two (2) rooms designated as office space, laundry area, an attached garage (utilized as a classroom), and backyard area. Living room: has sofas, chairs, a mounted TV, multiple shelves that store books and games, a gas burning fireplace equipped with a security screen, and patio doors that open to the backyard. Dining room: has a wooden table with ten (10) chairs, a mounted TV, a gas burning fireplace equipped with a security screen, and patio doors that open to the backyard. Kitchen: has a refrigerator, two (2) freezer drawers, a six (6) burner gas stove (all operational at the time of the inspection), a dishwasher, and a microwave. The kitchen has a pantry stocked with snacks, seasonings, and non-perishable food. Additionally, food is prepared by a private chef. Sharp knives are stored in a combination lock wooden box that is located in a locked kitchen cabinet next to the stove and made inaccessible. There is an additional table equipped with six (6) chairs to the right of the kitchen. Group Room: has eight (8) chairs, a mounted TV, a movable white board, multiple shelves that store yoga matts, a gas burning fireplace equipped with a security screen, and patio doors that open to the backyard. The contains two (2) closets. Additionally, the room has a bathroom equipped with a toilet, sink, shower, tub, and a closet used for storage. LPA observed that all closets in this room remain locked at all times. Medication room: has a desk, chair, multiple locked cabinets for PRN medications, a sink, a First Aid kit, and two (2) small refrigerators, one is used to store medication requiring refrigeration. Report continued on LIC 809C (Page 1 of 3)

2 Offices: The first office is located near the entrance of the facility and is used by the clinician. This office has a desk, chair, printer, and lamp. The second office is located to the right of the kitchen and is used as a therapy room. The room has a desk, chair, sofa, a mounted TV, and a closet used for storage. There is an attached bathroom that is equipped with a sink, toilet, and shower. Laundry area: is located to the left of the entrance along the hallway and it is equipped with a washer, dryer and two (2) storage cabinets. The laundry detergent and cleaning supplies are stored in locked closet adjacent to laundry area. Attached garage (Classroom): The garage has been converted into a classroom. The classroom is equipped with six (6) computers, six (6) desk, eight (8) chairs, classroom supplies, and ample cabinets which is used to store classroom supplies. The room contains a regulation fire extinguisher and a combination smoke detector/carbon monoxide alarm that is connected to the smoke alarm system in the house. The Fire Inspector confirmed the space was permitted for classroom use. Backyard area: contains a combination basketball/tennis court, a grill, a fenced and gated pool/jacuzzi that meets regulations, two (2) detached therapy rooms, and storage bin. Bedroom #1: is equipped with two (2) twin size beds, each containing two (2) pull out drawers. The room has built in shelves, a window, and an attached bathroom (equipped with toilet, sink, shower/tub combination). LPA observed the room to have a locked closet used to store the facility’s internet system and ADT system. Bedroom #2: is equipped with two (2) twin size beds, each containing two (2) pull out drawers. The room has a closet with ample space, a window, and shares a Jack and Jill bathroom with Bedroom #3. Bedroom #3: is equipped with two (2) twin size beds, each containing two (2) pull out drawers. The room has a closet with ample space, a window, and shares a Jack and Jill bathroom with Bedroom #2. All bedrooms were all observed to have mattresses, pillows, bed linens, blankets, and working lights. Bathrooms: All bathrooms were checked and found to be in working order. The hot water was tested, and the temperature was found to be between 105 -120 (F). LPA observed the home to have regulation fire extinguishers. The smoke detectors and carbon monoxide alarm were tested and found to be operating properly. The First Aid kit was checked and found to be complete with scissors, tweezers, thermometer, and gauzes, antiseptic and First Aid Manual Guide. Extra linens, hygiene supplies, and disinfectants were stored in locked hallway closets. Temperatures in client rooms and common areas were found to be between 68 - 85 degrees (F). Disinfectants/cleaning solutions and poisons are stored and inaccessible to clients. There are no security bars or screens on the windows. There are chimes on the exit doors. There are no firearms or dangerous weapons in the home. Report continued on LIC 809C (Page 2 of 3)

LPA observed the facility to be clean, safe, sanitary and in good repair. The outdoor spaces were clean and clear of hazards. Passageways, open porches, and all exits were observed to be unobstructed. Licensee ensures that individuals supervising children in the pool area are Water Safety trained. The gas shut-off valves are located in the back of the home, the water shut off valve is located in the front the home near the garage, and the electrical panel is located on the side of the home near the driveway. The facility operates within license conditions and limitations including capacity limitations. LPA discussed and advised facility staff to ensure the following: Children are afforded their Personal Rights. Children are allowed and encouraged to contact the licensing agency or the Foster Care Ombudsperson, in confidence, without threats or punishment for making complaints. Children are accorded dignity in personal relationships with others in the home. All posting requirements for Group Home Licensure, including the Emergency Plan, and grievance procedure were met and posted on the wall. The LPA reiterated the importance of submitting Special Incident Reports and reporting all changes within the facility to Community Care Licensing and any other appropriate agency. Licensee will ensure to utilize the Unusual Incident Report LIC 624, and LIC 624LE to document incidents. Transportation: The facility uses a 2023 Honda, Odyssey to transport youth to appointments and offsite extra curriculum recreational activities. LPA inspected the vehicle and found horn, lights, and all seatbelts in working order. The vehicle is equipped with a complete First Aid Kit, and Roadside emergency kit. LPA observed the vehicle to have valid car insurance through Farmers Insurance. Facility staff provided LPA with a copy of the Personnel Report (LIC 500) and Current Client Roster (LIC 9020). Clients Records are electronically stored in the facilities online Portal with Kipuworks.com and Staff Records are electronically stored in the facilities online iSolve system. LPA will return at a later date to review staff and client files. There are no deficiencies observed or cited at this during this inspection. An exit interview was conducted with the Administrator, and a copy of this report was left at the facility. (Page 3 of 3)

On 12/14/2023, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) C. White, made an visit to Ascend Healthcare 6, for the purpose of conducting a Case Management Annual Continuation Inspection. LPA met with Administrator, Jacqueline Marshall Waldron and was granted access to the facility and provided the requested information. The facility keeps clients records electronically stored in an online system call KIPUERM and staff Records are electronically stored in the ISolved system. LPA reviewed the following records during the inspection: Client Records: The program currently has a total of six (6) clients. LPA reviewed all six client records and found each record to meet required regulations. Staff Records: The program currently has a total of thirty staff. LPA reviewed a total of five (5) staff records and confirmed files contained staff qualifications, current CPR/First Aid cards, health screening, and TB test results. LPA obtained the LIC 500 to verify Staff to Client ratio. LPA reviewed the Facility Profile and Personnel Report and confirmed that personnel have required criminal record clearance: DOJ, FBI and Child Abuse; which meet qualification. LPA conducted interviews with three (3) clients and a total of three (3) staff. This inspection included an overview of required Core Services and Supports and based upon inspection of facility records and interviews of staff and clients. Licensee is meeting all requirements. PER California Code Regulations, TITLE 22, DIVISION 6, CHAPTERS 5 no deficiencies were cited. An exit interview was conducted, and a copy of this report was left with the Administrator.

On June 14, 2024, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) C. White made an unannounced visit to Ascend Healthcare #6 for the purpose of conducting a Case Management for Special Incident Report. The incident occurred on 06/09/2024 and the report was received by the Department on 06/13/2024. LPA met with Assistant Facility Manager, Aida Hernandez. During this visit, confidential interviews were conducted. LPA requested a copy of LIC 500, Client Roster, Client #1 (C1) intake paperwork and medical documentation, Facility seizure protocol, and Incident documentation. Based on the information obtained, this incident needs further investigation. There were deficiencies cited per Title 22 Regulations on this date. Exit interview conducted and a copy of the report was left with Assistant Facility Manager.

On June 14, 2024, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) C. White conducted an unannounced case management inspection at the above facility. Upon arrival, LPA was greeted by Louis Perez Langlois, Lead Mentor, who granted access to the facility. Assistant Facility Manager, Aida Hernandez arrived at a later time to meet with LPA. During today's inspection, LPA C. White observed the following: There was no facility manager present at the facility. Three beds in bedroom 1, which occupies 3 clients (see LIC 811) One bed in the office adjacent to the medication office, which occupies 1 client (see LIC 811) At time of inspection, LPA took pictures of the deficiencies. Per California Code Regulation, Title 22, Division 6, CHAPTERS 5, General Licensing Regulations the following deficiencies were observed and cited at the time of this inspection. (See LIC 809-D). An exit interview was conducted, and a copy of this report was left with Assistant Facility Manager.

deficiencies.plan_of_correction: Personnel Requirements (d)The licensee shall designate at least one facility manager to be present at the facility at all times when children are present. This requirement is not met as evidence by: Based on LPA observation there was no facility manager present in the facility during the duration of this inspection.

Buildings and Grounds (b)(1) No more than two children shall share a bedroom. This requirement is not met as evidence by: Based on LPA observation at the time of this inspection there are three (3) beds set up in bedroom #1 and the room occupies three (3) clients.

Buildings and Grounds (b)(4) No room commonly used for other purposes shall be used as a bedroom. This requirement is not met as evidence by: Based on LPA observation at the time of this inspection there is one (1) bed is set up in the therapy office adjacent to the mediation office which occupies one (1) client.
