facility_name: BEA'S YOUTH TREATMENT HOME FOR GIRLS
narrative:
Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Jose Gonzalez conducted a relocation site tele inspection (via Face Time due to the COVID-19) at Bea's Youth Treatment Home. During the visit present was Administrator Jossye Trivino-Cook. This home is a 6 bed private placement, girls home. Administrator stated this program is for drug addicted minors to stabilize within 30 days and then minors will be transitioned to outpatient treatment. During the relocation inspection the following was observed: *This is a two-story home *Dining room equipped with large table and chairs, enough for the 6 clients in care. *Staff office equipped with desk, chairs, computers, white boards, filing cabinets that lock for confidential information, office supplies, operational supplies, fax and copy machine. Staff files are kept at the main office. First aid kit was observed in staff office and a mini fridge with a lock to store medications. A separate staff medication box with a lock was observed for non-refrigerated meds. *There are 3 full restrooms in this home. All are in operable working order. Hot water temperature is within regulations. *Main family room designated for client program. Equipped with large sofa and television. *The home has an activities room for clients such as puzzles, games, arts and crafts supplies. This room will also be used for groups. *Open kitchen which will be used for meal prepping and for skill building for clients. LPA observed pots, pans, lids, dishware, eating utensils, cooking utensils, cups, mugs and all the large kitchen appliances. Stove, microwave, freezer, refrigerator and oven. All sharp knives are locked in a box stored in staff office. *Supply closet with cleaning supplies, brooms and vacuums. *In the garage their a second refrigerator with additional nonperishable foods and perishable foods. *Bedroom #1 designated for 2 clients. 2 twin size beds, mattress pads, and bedding. A full dresser and a full bathroom in operable working order. The hot water in the client bathroom was measured to be within safety requirements. **********CONTINUED on 809C********

*Bedroom #2 designated for 2 clients. 2 twin beds, mattress pads and bedding. A full dresser. *Bedroom #3 designated for 2 clients. 2 twin beds, mattress pads and bedding. A full dresser. *Full hallway restroom designated for client and staff use. *Hall closet designated for client hygiene supplies equipped with an individual tote for each client filled with hygiene supplies. LPA observed extra supplies of towels and linens. *The facility smoke detectors are in all bedrooms, office, hallway, and carbon monoxide were checked and were operable. *The Personal Rights, Grievance Procedures, Visitation Policies and Resident House Rules are posted in an area where clients have access (front room area) as well as the Emergency Disaster Plan. *In the backyard LPA observed a swimming pool surrounded/ enclosed with a five-foot-tall wrought iron fence with a self-closing and self-latching gate. The area is free of hazards. * There are no guns or weapons on site per staff. * LPA informed facility administrator that she has to submit a wavier in writing for use of the cameras in common areas, a plan for usage and a sketch of where every indoor and outdoor camera installed. An exit interview was conducted and a copy of this report was provided to facility representative, Ms. Trivino-Cook. Ms. Trivino-Cook agreed to sign reports and will email signed reports to LPA. Signed reports will be placed in the facility file.

facility_name: BEA'S YOUTH TREATMENT HOME FOR GIRLS
narrative:
At 10:19 AM, Licensing Program Analyst’s ( LPA’s) Anastasia Flores and Lorena Valenzuela arrived unannounced to conduct a visit to the facility for the purpose of the Annual inspection. At 10:43 AM, LPA’s were assisted and toured the facility by Administrator Assistant, Ruby Barajas. The facility Administrator, Ms. Jossye Trivino-Cook was on leave but was able to assist with the tour via telephone was contacted via telephone and arrived at the facility during the inspection. There are currently two clients in the facility. The facility is a split-level residence home and has three bedrooms, three bathrooms, art room and one staff office. The bedrooms are arranged so that no more than two clients share a room, and there is one client per bed. There is adequate shelf and closet space for client’s belongings. The bathrooms were clean and in good repair. The hot water in the client bathroom was measured to be 110.1 degrees and within safety requirements. The facility outside grounds was also inspected and were observed to be clean and well maintained. Emergency exits were free from obstruction. There is a swimming pool/bodies of water located on the facility premises, the gate needs to be corrected to open outward. The facility also has an approved CCLD exception for the surveillance cameras located throughout the interior/exterior common areas of the facility. The home also has central air conditioning/heating and seemed to be a comfortable temperature. The facility's smoke detectors in bedrooms number #1, office and hallway were checked and were operable. The smoke detectors in room #2, #3 were in-operable and not in place. The carbon monoxide detector was operable and located in the main hallway near kitchen area and one upstairs in the hallway. All hazardous items have been properly made inaccessible in areas where clients will have access. The First Aid Kit is complete with an exception of thermometer, staff stated it was broken and needs to be replaced. The medications were stored and locked in closet in the staff office space. Cleansers/chemicals and sharps are inaccessible and stored in a locked cabinet in the hall closet. There are no guns or weapons on site per staff. LPA observed a minimum 7-day non-perishable and a 2-day perishable supply of food. There was a variety of snacks available for clients as well.

Based on interview and record review, the executive director stated the emergency drills are conducted once a month, however no written evidence was maintained at the facility. This facility is being cited for Title 22, division 6, Section, 80023(d)(2) Disaster and Mass Casualty Plan. Based on interview and record review, the licensee did not maintain the client’s medication records in a centrally stored location. This facility is being cited for Title 22, division 6, Section 80075(k)(7), Health Related Services. Based on observation, the gate to the pool swung towards the pool instead of away from the pool. This facility is being cited for Title 22, division 6, Section, 80087(e)(1) Building and Grounds. Exit interview conducted and a copy of this report, LIC809D’s, Technical violation 9102TV and Technical Assistance forms,9102TA was provided to Executive Director, Lionel Contreras.

At 2:29 PM LPA’s reviewed two client files. This program is purely voluntary and based on a medical necessity. It is privately funded. Client stay is 30 to 60 days. The Personal Rights, Grievance Procedures, Visitation Policies and Resident House Rules are posted in an area where clients have access as well as the Emergency Disaster Plan. LPA Valenzuela interviewed two clients and they feel safe in the home where staff treat them with respect. One client did not have more than one day of clothing, executive director, Lionel stated the clients are taken to get purchase clothes upon entry. The following forms are to be updated and returned to the licensing office within 7 days (10/21/2021): LIC 309 (Administrative Organization), LIC 500 (Personnel Report), LIC 610 (Emergency Disaster Plan for Children’s Residential), quarterly board notes for June of 2021. Based on observation and interview, the licensee did not have a thermometer in the first aid kit. This facility is being cited for Title 22, division 6, section 80075(g)(1)(G), Based on observation and interview, the facility is a two-story building where full-time staff is not present at all times on each floor when children are present, and no signal system installed. This facility is being cited for Title 22, division 6, Section, 84088(e)(2), fixture, furniture, equipment and supplies. Based on observation and interview, the licensee did not ensure that one of two clients had more than one day of clothing available. This facility is being cited for Title 22, division 6, Section, 84072(d)(6)(A), Personal Rights. Based on observation and interview , LPA's observed a menu posted, however the menu was not dated. This facility is being cited for Title 22, division 6, Section, 80076(a)(5) Food Service. Based on observation and interview, the licensee did not have client roster immediately available at the facility. This facility is being cited for Title 22, division 6, Section, 80071(a)(1) Register of clients. Based on interview and record review, the licensee is having meetings on a quarterly basis. Based on review of September 2021, board meeting minutes there was no discussion about incidents involving law enforcement contact at the facility. This facility is being cited for Title 22, division 6, Section, 84063(a) Accountability.
